text: Burmasigi (; , Burmæsyg — ″yellow tower″) is a village in the historical region of Khevi, north-eastern Georgia. It is located on the left bank of the river Tergi, on the southern slopes of the Khokhi Range. Administratively, it is part of the Kazbegi Municipality in Mtskheta-Mtianeti. Distance to the municipality center Stepantsminda is 41 km. == Sources == * Georgian Soviet Encyclopedia, V. 2, p. 580, Tbilisi, 1977 year. ==References== Category:Kobi Community villages
title: Burmasigi
